snippet: In a major precedent relating to conditions in an American maximum security prison, the court allowed for the extradition of the cleric Abu Hamza al-Masri and four other defendants.
abstract: European Court of Human Rights rules that Britain can legally extradite five suspects wanted in the United States on terrorism charges, unprecedented decision that appears likely to greatly ease extradition of other suspects; all suspects, including Egyptian-born cleric Abu Hamza al-Masri, face the possibility of life sentences without parole.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Scott Shane contributed reporting from Washington and Benjamin Weiser from New York.

lead_paragraph: In a major precedent relating to conditions in an American maximum security prison, the court allowed for the extradition of the cleric Abu Hamza al-Masri and four other defendants.

headline.seo: European Court Says Britain Can Send Terror Suspects to U.S.
headline.main: European Court Says Britain Can Send Terror Suspects to U.S.
headline.print_headline: European Court Says Britain Can Send Terror Suspects to U.S.
